values:
Psalms 51:12 "Restore to me again the joy of your salvation, and make me willing to obey you."
I had the chance to go back to Mexico during spring break this year, and since that trip finding the joy I once had has been the underlying prayer of my heart.  I went to Mexico seeking rest and hoping to leave some baggage and hurt behind me.  The trip took me out of my element just enough that I had to feel all of the emotions that I had been numbing at home and allowed me to be myself again.  I didn't want to leave.  Here I am not myself right now because of the many restrictions of my injury and my own inability to handle it all correctly.  I am in no way fully where I need to be yet, but returning home has made me face some issues I have been running from, and I've been learning a lot since that trip.  Lesson #1: God doesn't give us a path, God IS the path. I have stressed and stressed and re-stressed over whether or not I should quit soccer.  It is in my nature to analyze things because I've always been taught to weigh my options and pick the "right" choice.  While I have sought peace, I have found restlessness.  I am now beginning to understand that there is not always a "right" choice, sometimes it's just a choice. (And how blessed I should feel to have that choice)  Wasting my time on discovering the pros and cons of each option has only dug me farther and farther into a hole that has kept me nowhere.  I am learning that God often places us in circumstances that are unclear in order for us to choose Him first and walk second. Deuteronomy 30:11-16 says "This command I am giving you today is not too difficult for you to understand or perform.  It is not up in heaven, so distant that you must ask, 'Who will go to heaven and bring it down so we can hear and obey it?'  It is not beyond the sea, so far away that you must ask, 'Who will cross the sea to bring it to us so we can hear and obey it?'  The message is very close at hand; it is on your lips and in your heart so that you can obey it.   Now listen.  Today I am giving you a choice between prosperity and disaster,  life and death.  I have commanded you to love the Lord your God and to keep his commands, laws and regulations by walking in His ways.  If you do this, you will live."  Lesson #2: God grants ALL of us a place of belonging. This hasn't always been an easy thing for me to see.  I could quote you a million verses that say "He will never leave us or forsake us" and that He is "with us always", but I can't say that I have felt it in the past several months.  If you dig a little deeper into who Christ was speaking to when he said these things you can discover why we sometimes feel alone.  Christ was not speaking to people who had already figured everything out.  He was not speaking to individuals who had their lives planned out for themselves.  Christ spoke to the desperate.  He spoke to people who were grateful for what He had done for them, people who were generous in serving Him, and people who were willing to courageously take risks for the cause of Christ.  This requires a life and attitude that is selflessly devoted to one thing...HIM.  It doesn't involve looking at the minor things (which when self-focused can seem VERY major things) in life, but instead focuses solely on Christ, trusting that He will take care of the rest.  Soccer is what I have desired for my ENTIRE life... I have been desperate to return to it,  taken many risks to pursue it, felt out of place without it, all the while questioning God as to why He would take such a precious thing away.  It is why I have felt alone.  God does not place blessings in our lives to replace Him, He gives them to us to glorify Him.  While soccer has given me many opportunities to share Christ and what He has done for me, having it taken away is allowing me to redefine just how glorious He is, and how little I am.  Lesson #3: When we belong to Christ, joy is contagious.  This brings a few individuals in my life to mind.  In recent months I have continued to see the joy of one of my friend's infect those around her.  I've made many a trip to see her just to get a taste of that joy.  I have also been blessed to see that type of joy restored to another one of my friends, and it has in turn been a HUGE blessing to me.  Where do they find it? and how do they keep it? This is a question that I am still learning how to answer fully, but one thing I am learning is that JOY is a choice.  It is not based on circumstances and happenings, but is based on who we are in Christ.  You can't fake it and you can't hide it.  It is attractive, infectious, and it does not allow our countenance to be defeated because it is not based on ANYTHING but CHRIST.  I will return to the doctor this Friday with these lessons in hand.  I still am unaware of what decisions will be made and what questions will remain, but I will follow Him, will be reminded that I belong to Him, and will continue seeking the type of Joy that will never allow me to leave a room the same way I found it.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/7995.html

MY 12 JOYS IN LIFE:
1. Hugs (especially "behind the back" and Nick Acord ones)
2. Acoustic Guitar (preferibly when Blayo Ayo is singing praise and worship)
3. Hibachi Grills
4. Lillies and Tulips
5. The feeling of stepping onto a soccer field
6. Random late night chats with family and friends
7. The smell of winter
8. Naps in the rain 
9. Fishing/Sitting on a lake
10. Mud (mud riding, mud football, mud fighting, mud sliding, mud....)
11. Bubble Baths
12. The innocence and joy that little kids find in life
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/7765.html

" Why does my suffering continue? Why is my wound so incurable? Your help seems as uncertain as a seasonal brook, it is like a spring that has gone dry." The Lord replied, "If you return to me, I will restore you so you can continue to serve me.  If you speak words that are worthy, you will be my spokesman.  You are to influence them; do not let them influence you!  They will fight against you like an attacking army, but I will make you as secure as a fortified wall.  They will not conquer you, for I will protect and deliver you. I, the Lord, have spoken I will certainly keep you...I will certainly rescue you"-Jeremiah 15:18-21

     Life has been very busy lately.  It has been a long time since I've written on this thing, and a lot has gone on.  I finally had my third surgery and the results were better than I ever could have expected.  My bone had completly healed over and my future progress looked extremely promising.  The news was definite answered prayer...to think that 6 months prior surgeons were telling me that I would never heal and that pain-free activity could never again exist.  While I was ecstatic about the news, as weeks  have passed and I  have moved forward in rehab, I am becoming skeptical.  The lateral pain in my ankle, most likely from the arthritis, has again returned to the level that it was before.  I know that I am capable of dealing with that type of pain, I've done this before...I know that it can be kept at a bearable level... BUT,  the constant daily reminder that the pain brings is starting to wear on my emotions...is this really possible, and why in the world am I doing this to my body?  I cannot help but wonder if this is truly the place I am supposed to be in life right now.  Am I wasting my time on this venture purely because I cannot find the strength to let go of my sport, or is this a test to discover if I am willing to pursue a greater purpose for my life??  I still feel like I'm in limbo.  On the one hand I am terrified to death of letting go of soccer...losing it would mean losing so many other things in life and would require a tremendous leap of faith to do...but on the other hand I fear that if I stay where I am that it will destroy me...the pain is wearing and the atmosphere that I am in is lacking in encouragement and happiness to say the least...I feel very alone and misunderstood.  Soccer has always been a sarifice of time, but playing was always a reward that outweighed the negatives... is it still worth it without the ability to play?  So many questions are unanswered right now, and so much advice has been thrown in my direction.  Some say to quit, that I have been given talents and abilites that cannot be utilized until I find a way to let go.  Others say stay, that God is using me with my team and with all of those around me because of the battle with pain that I have continued to fight with my faith.  I don't know what to do at this point...both choices seem logical, both make sense, yet I cannot find peace in choosing either one.  I want His will for my life...but I can't seem to hear it clearly.  I am out of ideas.  I know that obedience often requires us to be patient, but I don't want to just sit around while my life passes me by, and I don't think that God wants me doing nothing and being miserable either.  I still don't understand why I am where I am...and I am still unsure of what exactly God is doing in my life right now...but I do think that in order to see just how powerful HE is, God is asking me to wait.  Waiting SUCKS...when that word comes to mind I automatically think about being delayed, or wasting my time while anticipating the thing that actually has value...waiting rooms  have always seemed like a waste of time to me, why not just schedule an appointment 15 minutes later so you can go straight in?  What I often fail to remember (often because I can't see it) is the preparation that occurs during that waiting period.   It is during that time that the service/thing that I anticipate so much is being prepared.  Scripture reminds me that Christ does the same thing with us...it says that He refines us and perfects us during those times.  Scripture also reminds me that I am not alone as I wait, and that I have been put in this place for a specific purpose...I HAVE to  continue believing that.  And because that is my belief, I must continue finding ways to discover joy in where I am...the pain OFTEN distorts my view making it nearly impossible to see the beautiful things that could be going on outside of it.  I still don't think quitting is the right thing right now.  While choosing to do so would be scary, I almost feel like it is an easy way out.  It would solve SO many issues, but I don't think my heart would be content.  In the mean time...I'm working on not letting my foot or the advice of others direct my decisions and I'm seeking happiness and joy from the "little things" life throws my way..I'm trusting that Christ will continue to direct my heart and that He will comfort me as I wait for the "thing" He is preparing for me :).
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/7517.html

"The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over expecting different results"-Ben Franklin.

It's not that anything around me has changed all that much, or that all my issues have suddenly been solved, but the past several weeks have been....freeing.  I guess that sounds a little bit funny, but I'm not sure how else to describe it.  Before the break, I was still feeling overwhelmed with all that was going on with my foot...the cycle of being happy and ok one day and distraught and lost the next had been tearing me apart for most of the semester...it had left me feeling breathless. What is it that keeps my head and heart from making the connection that I only need to seek satisfaction and affection from a single source? Why is it that one minute I can trust and devote my life to that source, and the next doubt and fear that it even exists??  Why do I continue to allow the world around me to speak claims of my life that have already been destroyed and atoned by that source?  I don't know how many times I have been faced with learning the same stupid lessons over and over again, but my faith has definitely been tested this past semester and the answers are hitting hard this time.  Continuing to hold onto pain and continuing to revisit the hurts of my past has again gotten me nowhere... if anything at all it has only brought me back to the same issues I run from.  It used to feel odd letting go of something like that...my struggle with holding on arose in feeling that if I moved past those hurts they would lose value, and in turn I would lose value. Hearing the concerns and opinions of others on the direction of my life has also left me distraught.  Am I not good enough, strong enough, capable enough to be trusted to live life the way I have chosen?  What am I doing wrong?  What do I need that I don't already possess?  When will I ever be enough? Questions like these were ripping me apart.  The loss of the one thing that I had always had security in left me feeling unsure of anything and ashamed of who I was without it...and then, out of nowhere...I caught my breath.  

 The apostle Paul claimed in Philippians 3 that everything else paled in comparison to knowing Christ.  He said "I have discarded everything else, counting it all as garbage, so that I may have Christ and become one with him. I no longer count on my own goodness or my own ability to obey God's law, but I trust Christ to save me.  For God's way of making us right with himself depends on faith.  As a result, I can really know Christ and experience the mighty power that raised him from the dead." Looking backward and holding on isn't helping me feel any better or more valuable because it is keeping me trapped.  Seeking value in the wisdom and insight of others is restraining me from discovering and loving me as He claims me.  My life and what I seek from it can only happen through the freedom that my faith claims.  I want to live my life unleashed.  I want to press forward holding nothing back to forage my own rugged path without the fear and doubts of unanswered questions.  I want to know that even when I have screwed up, even when I've been left beaten down by what life throws at me... even when the world screams in my face that I am unworthy, I want to know that it's all worthless when compared to what Christ did for me... because he values and loves me WITHOUT expectation. I want to experience what Paul was talking about and I'm ready to discard everything else in order to discover it.  Like I said, it's not that the life around me is changing all that much...but through everything the strength of my faith has, and I am already seeing a different result.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/6936.html

Give me a man with courage.   Find me a man with the strength and the boldness to fight.  Show me a man who finds pride in his battle, but seeks humility in the face of what he fights for.  Give me a man with passion, a man who does not give up. Let me be a woman of virtue.  Allow me to embrace the alluring beauty that I posses, and the wisdom to hold and keep it captivating and mysterious. Provide me with patience.  Fill me with the assurance and peace that my future is held in the comfort of Your loving embrace.  Grant me with the eyes to see beyond my circumstances and beyond my past.  Help me to understand.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/6743.html

I went through one of my old journals tonight trying to find some sort of encouragement, inspiration, direction...anything!  I'm SO lost right now.  I no longer know which direction is right, and I don't understand why everyone keeps insisting that I give up. I just want everyone to shut up!  My brain is so consumed with everybody's opinions and advice, along with my own emotion and thoughts that I can't think straight anymore...all I want is His voice, His guidance...HIM.  What I found tonight was something that I wrote the night before my sophomore preseason began...the night before the season that would bring my injury and so much along with it.  I vividly remember writing it to try and release my nerves so that I could sleep before the big day...I laugh to think back on how HUGE of an obstacle that preseason seemed to me at the time, and how minor of an event it now holds in my memory.  This is what I wrote:

August 2004-- 'When some people might quit after any one of these things, I find more drive to pick up the pieces and build something even better.  I know that we can succeed, sometimes you just have to close your eyes, take a deep breath, and have a little faith, because at the end of the day, we know that God has a reason for everything we endure.'  He has created me for His purpose.  I am to be a vessel for His work and His work alone.  He will not leave me, He will not forsake me, and He will never give me a task that I cannot handle without His strength.  He is my power in my weakness.  He is the vine, and I merely a branch.  I am to seek His will with enthusiasm, never looking back...striving for the goal and purpose He has planned for me.  I have been blessed with a gift that I am to use for Him and Him alone.  He would not and will not give me a task that I cannot handle.  He is my strength, my fortress, and the stronghold of my life. Nothing is impossible for Him, and nothing is impossible with Him.  Tonight I go to sleep in peace, knowing that good or bad, His will shall be done..and for that, I should be filled with joy and excitement for all of the tasks that are about to be at hand.  I will be anxious for nothing, and will ask Him to take over everything.  He shall be first, and I must be last.  I have been given an incredible opportunity that can be taken away in an instant.  I must use it for His purpose every moment that I can with everything that I have.  I will not let fear overpower me.  I will not let fear paralyze, intimidate, or prevent me from completing His tasks.  I will press on, I will be courageous, I will be passionate, I will be untouchable in His hands.  I will not be harmed.  He will be my unyielding protection.  Men may say, do or imply things to frighten me, but they will "wither like blades of grass".  I will press on, just as Christ did for me, enduring the seemingly impossible, knowing that the end result is worth giving up my life!  He is why I am here.  He is why I live, and I will live freely and courageously as He did for my life. "I shall run and not grow weary, I shall walk and not grow faint." "He gives power to those who are tired and worn out.  He offers strength to the weak.  Even youths will become exhausted and young men will give up, but those who wait on the Lord will find new strength.  They will fly high on wings like eagles."

I sit here and wonder what in the world happened to me?  I was SO naive.  I was SO young in my faith.  Yet, I was SO trusting and dependent on my creator, because I didn't know how to do anything else, because all I felt was love.  Since that time it seems that I have been beaten down by several trials...my faith has been tested, and I find myself wondering if I ever truly felt what I once wrote...or was it all a front?  Doubts and fears have consumed me and taken a hold of my thoughts.  I want my faith back.  I want my hope back. I want to be able to let go and trust again.  I'm tired of the negativity, I'm tired of the struggle. I want freedom from these nagging thoughts that taunt me saying that I'm not good enough or worthy enough or strong enough to prove victorious.  I want direction and a release from the confusion that I have allowed to control me. I want Him.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/6640.html

"Why would God do something so cruel?  Why would He do something so terrible as to wound us in the place of our deepest wound?  Jesus warned us that 'whoever wants to save his life will lose it' (Luke 9:24).  Christ is not using the word bios here; he's not talking about our physical life.  The passage is not about trying to save your skin by ducking martyrdom or something like it.  The word Christ uses for "life" is the word psyche--the word for our soul, our inner self, our heart.  He says that the things we do to save our psyche, our self, those plans will actually destroy us.  'There is a way that seems right to man but in the end leads to death' says Proverbs 16:25.  The false self, our plan for redemption, seems SO right to us.  It shields us from pain and secures us a little love and admiration.  But the false self is a lie; the whole plan is built on pretense.  It's a deadly trap and God loves us too much to leave us there.  So He thwarts us, in many, many different ways...He will take away all that you've leaned upon to bring you life...This is the critical moment in one's life, when all you have counted on comes crashing down...What will [you] do? Will [you] stay in the game?  Will [you] shrink back in the dugout? Will [you] scramble to try and put things back together...?  The true test of man, the beginning of [our] redemption, actually starts when [we] can no longer rely on what [we've] used all of [our lives]...The real journey begins when the false self fails.... This is a very dangerous moment, when God seems set against everything that has meant life to us. Satan spies his opportunity, and leaps to accuse God in our hearts...The enemy always tempts us back toward control, to recover and rebuild the false self.  We must remember that it is out of love that God thwarts our impostor.  As Hebrews reminds us, it is the son whom God disciplines, therefore do not lose heart (12:5-6).  God thwarts us to save us.  We think it will destroy us, but the opposite is true--we must be saved from what will really destroy us...If we are to walk with Him...we must walk away from the false self--set it down, give it up willingly.  It feels crazy; it feels IMMENSELY vulnerable...Losing the false self is painful; though it's a mask; it's one we've worn for years and losing it can feel like losing a close friend.  Underneath the mask is all the hurt and fear we've been running from, hiding from...But this is not the end of the road; it's the trail-head.  What you are journeying toward is freedom, healing and authenticity."--John Eldridge. Wow.  God is SO perfect in His timing.  I could not have received these words at any better time than I did.  Since the age of four there has been an attachment to my name.  "This is Stephanie...she plays soccer." In that attachment I have found confidence, acceptance, love, joy, admiration, growth, consistancy...COMFORT.   But my comfort zone has been thwarted...and it has caused me MUCH pain and confusion.  While I have held on tightly to the truths that God has given me...deep down I have felt abandoned and quit on.  I have doubted myself and doubted my creator and it has made me want to give up.  There have been moments of happiness and glimpses of hope...but most of the time, there has been pain.  I haven't been myself in a while...I've missed the part of me that "shines"; the part of me that used to pour joy and encouragement into others, the smile that used to brighten someone's day, the strength that I used to have to persevere and pull others up with me when things seemed impossible, the faith and rest I used to find in the simplicity and beauty of just enjoying life.  I accepted the lie that I when I lost my attachment...when I lost my "love", that I had lost myself...and I was wrong.  The hardest part about losing soccer in the past year is that with it...I lost control over the identity that I thought God had created for me.  I have fought against it, scrambling to pick up the pieces and start over only to find it crumble before me over and over again...and I believe that it will continue to do so until I can release my "attachment" and accept the true identity that God has created for me...until I can accept that He and He alone has called me and kept me BEAUTIFUL.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/6206.html

Psalms 73:26 "My health may fail, and my spirit may grow weak, but God remains the strength of my heart; He is mine forever."

I was faced with the reality of the extent of my injury yet again at my most recent doctor's visit. My foot continues to decline and soccer has further slipped from my view. BUT, this is where it ends. This is where I stop showing my wounds to everyone around me, and this is where I stop living life out of my pain and hurt. Christ gave His LIFE...HIS LIFE...so that I could live mine HEALED..so why am I walking around wounded?? He has created and designed for me to be exactly where I am, doing specifically what I have been doing...with a hurt foot, no soccer, and all that it encompasses. THIS IS NOT AN OBSTACLE...it's not something I have to overcome and it's not a weakness that can hold me back from fulfilling the purpose that He has for me. I MADE IT THAT, and it's not going to upset me or control me anymore...it is merely an opportunity and blessing for me to be faithful and obedient in the role He has called me to. Although it may seem insignificant and minor in comparison to what my heart yearns for, it is VITAL because it is where He has placed me. Until I can accept and embrace the role He has given me, how can I ever expect Him to trust me with more? Pastor Dino reminded us today that David was only brought to His place of victory and triumph because his heart was faithful in the small things. He never would have met his Giant and defeated it had he not first taken care of his sheep and made the humble journey of bringing his brothers bread to the battle field. David knew his role, excepted it, embraced it, and stopped there. He wasn't looking for something greater because His heart found joy in being exactly where he was, doing the simple tasks he was called to do. It was God that brought him to his giant, and it was God that that provided him with the perfect timing and the perfect strength for his victory. I am where I am...and my heart embraces it because it's exactly where I am supposed to be.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/5745.html

I've told myself it isn't true.  I've fought myself saying that it cannot matter and that it should be ignored.  I've wondered if you ponder as I do...I've wondered if you still think how you used to. I have pushed and shoved my feelings aside...I've continually attacked you out of my own insecurity and fear...making you feel unappreciated and lacking.  But despite these things, I watch you...and I am continually intrigued. 

You are patient.  Patient enough to teach the unteachable just to see them smile.  Patient enough to endure indescribable pain and discomfort.  Patient enough to wait.  You are selfless.  Others needs always come first.  You daily put your pride and comfort aside in order to diligently serve those around you...those whom aren't always so deserving.  You are strong.  Physically, mentally, and spiritually you are solid...seemingly unbreakable.  In the face of adversity you rise in the strength of the ONE who holds you, and you do not fear.  You are trusting.  When faced with trials, you never question...you faithfully believe that it holds a higher purpose.  You are accepting.  You welcome all with open arms and a genuine regard for who they are.  You are a companion.  Loyal, faithful, and available in your own gentle,quiet, and amazing way. You are wise.  You don't waste time or fill you mind with thoughts of things and situations that you know are out of your control.  You seek truth and guidance and pour it into others. You are a hardworking, courageous man of God, and you are a blessing to many because of it. 

Even from a distance...You inspire me.  "May you [continue to] be filled to the measure of all the fullness of God"--Ephesians 3:19
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/5384.html

"O Lord, My heart is not lifted up; my eyes are not raised too high; I do not occupy myself with things too great too marvelous for me. But I have calmed and quieted my soul, like a weaned child with its mother; like a weaned child my soul within me. O Israel, hope in the Lord from this time and forevermore."--Psalm 131

I spent most of the summer knowing that at the end of it, I would have to let go of a blessing that was placed in my life in order to pursue soccer...a call that I KNOW God has created for me.  Weeks later, I find myself unable to pursue either of those things and I am filled with uncertainty.  Soccer has been put on hold because of my health, yet the status and schedule of an athlete still consumes me, and in a sense haunts me. There are NO guarantees of what will happen a year from now and to be honest I feel a little ripped-off.   I don't really understand anything right now. I don't want to be fighting a losing battle and I don't like feeling like my hopes have been deferred. Isaiah 46:10-11 says that "[His] counsel shall stand, and [He] will accomplish all [His] purpose."...He says that "[He] has spoken, and [He] will bring it to pass; [He] has purposed it, and [He] will do it." Although there is no spec of evidence that what I desire will happen...and even though I don't understand why I am in the place that I am, I know that He DOES NOT MAKE MISTAKES.  I have to believe that the pain and emptiness that I feel from this loss is preparing a strength and a space for something "too great and too marvelous for me" to understand, and therefore "too great and too marvelous for me" to be concerned with.  A baby who is weaned no longer cries in desperation for its mother's milk.  While it is still helpless, the child has full knowledge that its mother will provide for it, and instead patiently waits.  I have cried in desperation for too long over these matters... I want to be at a place where I can trust enough to have a peace while I wait to be provided for.  I have to believe that He is using me, that He will provide me with ALL that I need, and that my void WILL be filled.  Although I am not getting what I have been looking for I know that what is on my heart matters more to God than any situation I could ask for deliverance from...while I may never get the answer I'm expecting, He will answer me.  I continue to fight against becoming bitter and hurt, and I still don't understand..but a faith that requires no effort would never be a faith worth living out, so I will trust.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/4902.html

I've spent the past several weeks being very discouraged with life in general. I'm tired.  I'm tired of feeling alone and unhappy. The pain and frustration of dealing with disappointment after disappointment with my health, friends, and boys has again brought me to a place of confusion and feelings of abandonment. I've felt like I've been repeating the cycle of last year and have been angry that I could possibly be at that place again. I've done what I do best and have tried to fix it with worry and pity for myself.  I swear I give myself to much credit sometimes.  Believing that I could fix my "problems" is one thing, but feeling that God had abandoned me is ridiculous.  He is so much greater than that, and His vision is so much grander and clearer than mine will ever be. The disappointment that I often feel is nothing less than a result of my selfishness and impatience.  If I were truly pursing the life and purpose that I have been created for I would be doing what I know is right without expectation of return.  It is the lack of those expectations being fulfilled that leaves me distraught. I AM NOT MY OWN...we are called to live a life that reflects our creator, and we are to do His work and love his creations as we love ourselves---REGARDLESS of the return.  What I struggle with more than anything is trying to live that way without reaching the point where I feel empty and unable to give anymore...I start to feel sorry for myself.  Our world tells us that when we reach this point we need to search for things to satisfy us...screw how everyone else feels, look out for number one, demand the love, respect and attention that you "deserve" and THEN youll be happy.  That sounds nice and all...but every time I've tried that option I end up right back to where I was before.  Why?...because I AM NOT MY OWN...I don't "deserve" anything, and if I live my life with that attitude it discredits the fact that my life is a gracious, gracious gift.  The new option I've discovered....the new option that actually let me sleep last night...says that I was created for a greater purpose than that of pleasing myself and that the lasting satisfaction that I yearn for IS possible...but only if I seek it through Him and Him alone. "[His] purpose is to give life in ALL of its fullness"-John 10:10, and He knows full well exactly how to do that.  Today my heart is full and my mind is at rest because He has given me a life and love to share and NOTHING ELSE MATTERS. I am satisfied.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/4706.html

I don't speak often because I don't speak well.

So every song I write has a story to tell.

Of all I've learned living with myself.

So these are my pearls of wisdom in a nutshell.

You only live once so you better think twice.

This day will go before you know so dont waste your time

And when youre standing on a cloud or when your falling on the ground, you gotta find something to sing about.

Dont know much, that much is true.

My questions are endless, my answers are few.

But life has caused me to conclude...

I can face what I don't know, by singing about what I do.

You only live once so you better think twice.

This day will go before you know, so dont waste your time.

And when your lost inside yourself and can't find your way out, you gotta find something to sing about.

The world has a way of wearing you down and time is not afraid to take its toll.

But you can sing through anything as long as you know what awaits you at the end of the road.

Because you only live once, so you better think twice.

This day will go before you know so dont waste your time.

At the end of the day when you lay your head down, you gotta have something to sing about.

-Ginny Owens
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/4444.html

Sometimes I wish I could just shut my brain off...not completely, but long enough to ignore the part that constantly tells me to dig below the surface of what is placed in front of me.  Why is it so hard for me to accept things for face value??  Why can't I allow myself to believe that there are things that are genuine and all that they appear to be? I always find myself searching for more...whether it be a good or bad thing that is put in front of me, I find myself questioning and evaluating each situation trying to discover something greater than what really is.  I think somewhere in my messed up attempt to hunger and thirst after the direction God has planned for my life I convinced myself that I would eventually find a place where I would be fully and completely satisfied.  I get so caught up in the "what could be", "what should be", that I over analyze and over evaluate the value of the blessings that already ARE.  Instead of trusting that I have a God directing every minute detail of my life, I force myself into believing that the picture I have created as "ideal" is the only way things will work.  Whenever there is a bump, an obstacle I search for answers to why. He is where I should be seeking and resting my satisfaction in...not in what I believe to be best...and as those obstacles come, I should not question or fear them, but embrace them because of who I know created them. I have yet to reach the place  where I can blindly fall into the warmth and excitement of something new...I fear that if I ever do, I will be caught and held in a place of comfort and complacency...or even worse that I will never be caught at all. Because of that fear I push away the one thing that I truly want.  I want to be caught up in something greater than myself...I want to be swept away and embraced for who I am and who I want to be...but the truth is, I already am.  The only way I will be able to fully experience that kind of love is if I start resting and trusting that my life is held in the hands of my creator...who IS the very definition of love.  Challenges and obstacles will continue to surround the things I long for, but I refuse to continue to stress over them and ask what if.  I want to enjoy my present circumstances, and I CAN because I already am loved and held. --"Let not your heart be troubled, you believe in God, believe also in me."-John 14:1
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/3955.html

"Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak.  We are half-hearted creatures, fooling around with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at sea.  We are far too easily pleased."--C.S. Lewis

What would happen if we were honest?  Honest with ourselves, each other, and receptive to the yearnings of our heart?  What would happen if we ignored our insecurities, fears, and apprehensions...and instead boldly and courageously chased after our desires instead of being satisfied with temporary fulfillment?

I think we would be patient.  We would wait.  We would step back from our emotions, hormones, and the pressures of society, seeking instead to discover if what touched us was truly worthwhile.  We would be kind. We would be considerate, compassionate, and tolerant of others because of the vulnerability we chose to first show them. We would not fear rejection, temptation, or the challenges set before us because we would know the beauty we would eventually reach.  We would not have to create an illusion of something greater or boast in what we had because it alone would be sufficient.  We would be selfless.  Not because we were blinded, tricked or provoked by false expectations, but instead because we would know that what we were pursing was honest, real and pure. We would look past difficulties and trust.  We would have hope because we would have truth, and we would NOT give up.  I think we would finally see and experience the type of love that God intended for us...His love, a love that never fails.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/3655.html

So today was insane...I'm finding it really hard to get back into my "normal routine" of things, much less actually muster up the effort to cram for finals.  While the business of my life continues to swirl around me, I'm at a place where all things that would typically give me an ulcer over just don't seem all that important.  Now, I realize that putting off studying is probably a not so good idea, but the fact that I finally slowed myself down enough to realize what a beautiful day today was...that's exciting.  When George was coaching us he would always flaunt the easy life of "normal" college students in our faces.  In his attempt to see whether or not we were truly dedicated to playing for LSU he would point out all of the things we were missing out on in college...sitting in the quad with friends, laying out on the parade grounds, or just spending the afternoon tailgating before a football game.  I can vividly remember many a morning where we would run through the sprinklers...sprint after sprint, while he tempted us to give up.  At the time, I almost believed him.  I doubted whether or not it was all worth it, and wondered if I would regret the things I missed out on.  I worked my butt off, I hardly played, and all the dreams I had of playing in college seemed unrealistic, unattainable. Losing was awful, those mornings were awful...we would start running in the dark parts of the early morning and it would seem endless, but for some reason every time I got to see the sunrise, I knew that God had kept soccer on my heart for a purpose...I just wasn't sure what.  It seems as if working through my injury is allowing me to see that purpose fulfilled and it's UNBELIEVABLE!!!  My foot slowed me down just enough to step back and see the amazing life that I've been blessed to live.  While his intentions may have been good, George was wrong.  He had so much pressure on him to make sure that our team succeeded that he forgot the heart behind the matter.  He loved soccer just as much as any of us, but he let the pressures around him destroy his dream.  Yes, I miss out on A LOT of the typical college life...but I'm getting the chance to experience things that some people will never get to...all the while getting the opportunity to pursue my greatest passion everyday.  The life I have chosen to live brings many demands along with it, but if I let those demands consume and control me...I'm not going to enjoy the journey.  Like I said...today was insane, but it was also beautiful.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/3345.html

Forgive me for venting for a minute....

  I'm getting REALLY tired of being "friends" with girls that only call when they need something, or feel the desire to flaunt their achievements in my face.  Am I jerk for being ticked that they continue to make empty promises?  I have been raised in a family that has told me to have a servant's heart...to be selfless, loving others just as much as I love myself...but doesn't that leave the door wide open for you to get walked all over? We are supposed to forgive others when they hurt us, encourage them to change by living our lives in the image of Christ... He was selfless and loving to EVERYONE despite how much they rejected him.  I'm extremely confused...I try very hard to be a friend that is dependable and loving, but I fear at times that I'm doing something wrong.  I can't put on the happy face anymore, I can't act like everything's peachy....it's not.  I have ZERO females in my life that I feel like I could go to right now.  Yes, there is Erin and Kathryn....there is Artie, Michelle, Lisa...but none that are here day to day to have to lean on. I was hurt very deeply by one of my closest friends a while back and it has damaged my ability to trust girls ever since...I've tried everything to mend the friendship, but at times I wonder why I even bother.  Shouldn't she be the one putting forth some effort? Shouldn't she be the one trying to make things ok again? Is it to much to ask for her to be there for me for ONCE?...How in the world did I get to this place in my life?  I dropped everything...putting my hope in a relationship that looked like it would be lasting...I went against everything people were telling me and chose instead to follow my heart...but it almost feels at times that it was empty because in the end I lost everything.  I wish I knew how to start over, but I'm lost. Today was rough...I was again faced with the reality of the situation that has resulted from decisons I made in the past...I don't regret those choices, but it's often diffcult to face the results. It would be easiest to just continue believing that allowing my heart to be open and vulnerable will only result in more pain...but the TRUTH...if I leave up those walls I will never experience what I long for. At the moment of his deepest trial, Christ was able to endure because of the joy he knew was set before him. God is using the pain that I currently feel at times to shape an entire new source of strength and vitality that in the end will only allow me to show and give even more of the love I've grown to know from Him.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/3168.html

We went to Miami this weekend for our last two spring games...it was wonderful!  Nate kept me out of practice all last week to help me recover from the weekend before, hoping that I would be able to play some in Florida.  We left on Thursday night so we could get a practice in on Friday before the games...the practice left me in quite a bit of pain and added some new blisters to my good foot, but I promised Nate that I could make it through the last two games. When warmup on Saturday rolled around he caught my eyes watering up a bit and pulled me to the side.  I told him I really didn't know how much longer I was going to be able to do all of this. He prayed for me and told me that God would carry me through the next two games, I just had to trust Him.  While Nate has been concerned about my recovery, he has been equally or more concerned with my obvious desire for the coaches to see me play this spring...I can't tell you how happy I am that he challenged me to fight through the discomfort.  I don't think he realizes how much the team, especially me and Marie, are going to miss having him around next year.  I wouldn't have made it without him, and I hope that he, Heather and Cavin will be blessed wherever they end up next year...he is an inspiration both professionally and spiritually and I can only hope that I will be able to have a similar impact on the patients I work with one day.  On to other things, the tournament this weekend was to raise funds for Breast Cancer.  Brien arranged it to where all of the graduated seniors got to come with us...EVEN ROB!!!  The old crazy crew of girls was finally together again, and it was interesting to see how differently things were run under our new staff.  Brien accommodated to our needs tenfold, all the while making sure that we were being professional from the minute we left to the minute we got home.  Twenty rough and tough soccer girls in high heels and cocktail attire for the whole weekend...go figure, never thought I'd live to see the day that Robyn wore a skirt!  She spoke at the banquet that the tournament had on Friday night and I don't think there was a dry eye in the room.  Again, her courage amazes me, and it was the thought of her that kept me goin Saturday.  I feel like God is giving me the opportunity to be blessed by and to bless my teammates almost continuously right now.  I can't tell you how many conversations I had this weekend that just made my heart smile.  I got to room with Artie Brown, and seeing how similar our current lives are going...it could have ONLY been God that put us together to give one another much needed encouragement.  The fact that we woke up Sunday morning to a sermon on how being single is a gift from God just made me laugh.  We tied Miami and beat Marquette 1-0 in the tournament, and God let me leave the field with an unbelievable peace.  I scored my first collegiate goal, and I think it was His way of letting me know that if I continue to trust Him, everything is going to be more than ok.  The spring season has finally come to an end, and our exit meetings will be in two weeks.  I'm praying for wisdom for our coaches, and I have no doubt that they will make the right decisions with the last two cuts.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/2962.html

There is a hurt and angry place inside of me, a wound that harbors some rather strong doubts about how much God really cares for me.  It's hard to acknowledge that I distrust His love for me right now, but if I continue to ignore it...that wound will never fully heal.  I can't pinpoint the exact moment that my distrust began, but I know that lately...everytime I experience or hear His truth in my life, my heart aches...I want desperately to rest in the promises He has given me, but I am continually struggling to believe that they will occur anymore. I have constantly wondered about what I am supposed to be doing right now...whether or not the direction I have been taking with my life is still right.  The minute that my world became a little bumpy, I took my eyes of Him and began to doubt...I've wondered what in the world I did wrong and what do I still need to do that I haven't done already to fix it?  The approach I have been taking shows me precisely what the problem is, and the past few weeks have allowed me to see that all to well.  It is in our nature to do one of two things when we are desperate and afraid: we run...or we hold on tightly to whatever is around us, seeking comfort from it as we wait to be rescued.  Unfortunately in my own fear and desperation of what is to come in my life, I have tried both of those things. I have tried running from the obstacles set before me only to find more obstacles, and I have held onto what my heart sees as comfortable only to find frustration and disappointment at my heart's motivation.  My responses, while they have helped me to make some mistakes that I wish I could change, are not the problem...the desperation and fear that has resulted from my doubt is.  I have been blaming myself for a lot of things, and I have been doubting the loving nature of my creator because I have focused on the sinfulness: the pain, the selfishness, and the lies that consume our world, instead of seeing and believing the TRUTH..."God is GOOD, and everything He does is GOOD,"-Psalms 119:68...and it is because of the trials I have been through that He has allowed me to see that.  He is greater than my past, He is greater than my future, and He is great enough to allow me to rest in Him for my present circumstances.  To be completely honest, I don't have a clue what lies ahead for me right now.  But if I can allow myself to fully rely on Him again, then my future will be of no concern.  While there are many things that my heart seeks after right now...to continue my soccer career, to be a godly woman that is pursued and kept by a godly man, to be a friend and have friends that constantly encourage and push one another...my dreams will only be fulfilled within my Father's loving embrace...an embrace that requires complete belief and trust.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/2369.html

So...I GOT RELEASED TO PRACTICE ON MONDAY!!! (and I didn't even have to bribe Shawn with candy)  We didn't have practice yesterday, but we did have weights and running.  If you know me at all, then you know that I tried to do a lil much yesterday.  Yes, I'm sore...but it was so worth it!  I'm looking forward to practice this afternoon, but am extremely nervous.  I still haven't kicked straight on with my foot yet, and I'm concerned about how it's gonna feel when I finally do.  No worries though...I don't think anything could scare me enough to keep me away from playing at this point. haha...it's freaking me out how giddy I am right now.  Anyways, Kate's hosting another recruit this weekend.  If this girl signs it will be number 9...making the total count of cuts being made to a minimum of 3.  I think everyone on the team is feeling the obvious pressure to preform.  While I'm not looking forward to the cuts, the pressure has uped the expectations of work ethic and intensity during practice tenfold...and that's the kind of stuff I live for.  Regardless if I end up being let go before the fall or not, it's going to be an amazing ride getting there.  I know my game is about to grow a lot from the new coaching and if I can keep up my current attitude...I'm going to be in best shape of my life come August.   Kate and I are going to swim after practice and then I will be off to finish up shopping for the Mexico trip with my mom.  I've hardly gotten to talk to her at all this week, so I'm looking forward to some quality time at Wal-mart.  She's been having a rough time lately...trying to stay healthy herself on top of dealing with her grandmother's death as well as my grandma's declining health.  It's weird, and somewhat disheartening, that I can't help her cope with some of that stuff.  I know how difficult it is for me to see her in pain from the fibromyaligia...so I can relate that way, but having grown up so far away from my extended family it's hard to feel the same kind of hurt she does.  Yes, my great grandmother just passed away and my grandmother is having to go through multiple surgeries...while it's been a little hard I don't think it's affecting me as much as it might most people.  That sounds absolutely awful, I know, but I really don't know any of my extended family all that well because of the physical distance between us.  The lack of those tight family ties makes me desire something greater for my own family one day.  I know I will be close with my children and husband, but I wan't to be able to continue the closeness between my brothers and parents that I have now.  More importantly, I want to be able to be just as close to my children's children one day.  I've always said that I want to get out of this town...try something new, get a different perspective from a new environment.  While I still think that might do me some good, I'm a lot more unsure of how permanent or how far I would want to make that move.  Maybe this Mexico trip will give me the taste of change that I've been waiting for.  I don't know exactly what I will get from the trip, but I'm going to it open and willing to except whatever God has in store for me.
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/2199.html

Ken and I went out to the field today. I swear I could sit out there and stare for hours.  Somehow in the midst of spending hour after hour, day after day training with 24 other girls...you forget the beauty of it all.  I have an entirely new appreciation for just how lucky I am to be at LSU...an appreciation that I doubt I ever would have had without my injury.  Being out there today brought back SO many memories...I've had a lot of highs and a lot of lows through my collegiate career thus far, and thinking back on all of it... I wouldn't give back a single moment.  As cliche as it sounds, the blood, sweat and tears that I have put into this game has shaped the greater part of who I am.  I joke, but when it's all said and done, and my soccer career comes to an end...I really don't know what I'm going to do with myself.  While it's exciting to think about all of the new experiences I'm finally going to have the time to try, I will no longer have the luxury of being involved with developing my passion everyday.  We won our second spring game last night.  Everyone I talked to that came to the game was astound by how much our team has changed.  The girls are relaxed, they finally look like they are having fun again, and slowly the direct style of play that has been drilled into our heads for the past two years is starting to shift to real soccer.  It's amazing how much the game changes when a team passes...and ACTUALLY attacks forward from the wings. I can't put into words how excited I am about next fall.  It's only been two weeks of team training, and the improvements have been innumerable. Today, after Ken and I had kicked around for a while, he asked me about how I felt about the cuts Brian is planning on making.  He wanted to know if I thought my injury was going to hurt my chances of staying.  Of course that thought has crossed my mind on many occasion...I try to store the anxiety and fear as far back in my head as possible.  In reality, it's something that is out of my hands...I don't need to worry about it.  I know that, but like I tried to tell him..it's not always easy for me to live out that knowledge.  It's hard to ignore something that means so much to you...its hard to wait for answers...I leave for mexico next Friday, and I'm praying that I will be given a new perspective from the trip.  The people there are in SO much need, and I have a feeling it's going to hit me pretty hard.  In the grander scheme of things, what has been going on with me is NOTHING compared to what I could have been hit with.  I thank God for the protection He has faithfully and consistently covered me with, and I ask Him to forgive me for doubting so often.

Psalms 34:18 "The Lord is close to the brokenhearted; he rescues those who are crushed in spirit."

Hunter's grandfather passed away yesterday.  It was less than a month ago that he was diagnosed with leukemia and I know that Hunter's having a rough time right now.  This is the fourth person in his family to pass away in the past year and he just got finished trying to deal with the loss of his grandma during Christmas.  I don't ever know how to help in these kind of situations.  It seems like the people I am surrounded by are being continually hit with difficulties right now and it's starting to give me understanding for the kind of year I just went through. I don't know why bad stuff happens to people, but I do know this now: It seems that God often strips us of the things we love most in this world so that we will look up and find something greater to hold onto.  Every tear that we shed, every pain that we have, and every sorrow that we face HAS A PURPOSE BEHIND IT.  I know it's not always easy to see through the hurt, but if we look up there is hope; and in that hope is a lot of comfort and a lot of peace.  I hope Hunter can see that.  Onto other things, this weekend is our first spring game!!! We play Tulane on Saturday and while I am excited, I'm a lil nervous how the team is going to do with no subs.  Oh how I wish I could play right now...Brian gave me a little taste of practice on Wednesday and now I can't seem to shake the "itch" to play for real.  The good news is, since Nate gave Brian the ok for me to help in one of the practice drills...he finally got to see me play a little bit.  The BETTER news, my foot wasn't sore after that!!!  Granted, I didn't kick with the bad foot, but any progression is exciting news.  Maybe I will get a chance to play this spring after all :)
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/1719.html

It is extremely painful to let go of things that weigh so heavily on my heart.  A year ago my life seemed to be adding up.  The things that I had always believed God created my heart to chase after were starting to become a reality.  My hands grasped tightly in excitement at the thought of His promises being fulfilled.  Then, He asked me to let go.  It has been almost five months since I've been able to touch a soccer ball and it's been six months of being without one of the most meaningful relationships I've ever had.  As much as I try to deny, forget, and move forward...learning to live without those two things hurts.  With team practice having started last week and having seen Jeremy this past weekend I became a little more than overwhelmed.  Without soccer I am finding myself with very little places to "vent"...the place that I feel most like myself, least stressed, and most alive has been put on hold all because of a tiny bone no bigger than the size of my thumb.  It seems the more I try to push forward and recover, the more my foot fights back, so I'm left to sit and watch.  It's exciting yet frustrating all in one to sit on the side and watch my team progress under new coaching.  WOW.  The team is going to be amazing next fall...I just don't know if it's in His plans for me to be there with them.  Brian has yet to see me play a single minute of soccer and it freaks me out. Because of a little stubbornness on my part, a little impatience..not having the surgery when I could have...a man that I hardly know will determine the fate of the rest of my soccer carrer without ever seeing me play.  As far as mending a friendship with Jeremy...I just can't be myself around him anymore.  I HATE IT!  No one has ever seen so much potential in me...no one has ever pushed me and made me want to be more than I am like he has.  I get so frustrated around him because I feel like he can see all of my faults, but is no longer involved in my life to see how much I am trying to grow.  The more I try to "fix" things between us the more I seem to mess up the situation.  How many times am I going to have to learn this patience lesson?  Stressing is getting me nowhere and in the mean time my life is passing me by.  It's simple for someone to tell me to not worry about these things...but how do you train yourself to not be concerned about things that you love so much?  One thing is for sure...my faith is growing and my trust in His plans for me is strengthening.  Any opportuinity that I might have had to sway these situations has been stripped from me and I'm left with nothing but the ability to wait and be hopeful.--"Count it all joy when you fall into various trials, knowing that the testing of your faith produces patience.  But let patience have its perfect work, that you may be perfect, complete, and lacking nothing."
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/1439.html

ERIN IS COMING HOME IN 5 DAYS!!!!  I can't wait!  While that has my mood up quite a bit, last night was a lot of fun too. After one of the longest weeks I have had in a while it was nice to just go chill for a bit.  Kate and I went to weights early early (545) so we could go to the pview semi--the girls played REALLY hard, but unfortunately Neuman played that much harder.  It was fun to see April and Tina again and I think we all had a good laugh catching up with Coach Bob!  "What is the most dangerous play in soccer girls?"--if any of you ever figure out what in the world that man is talkin about...lemme know would ya?  Anyways, after the game I went to console Jon over the loss and sat with him at this authentic mexican resturant...we're talkin NOBODY in there speaking English but us.  His food looked really good, but I don't know if I'm ever gonna get the mexican smell out of my coat!!  Ken came and picked me up later on and we headed to Denham for homemade chilli and some quality time with his friends from church.  His friends are freakin hilarious...it's not often that you laugh at stories that involve people you dont even know, but they had me smilin the whole night.  It's awesome to see a group of college kids able to have a good time all the while being in fellowship with one another as believers.  I feel extremely lucky that I'm getting the chance to start to know Ken and his "posse" of friends. After the experiences I've had with people in the past few years, God is starting to show me that hoping to find real, genuine people with big hearts was not in vain. He is blessing me with those kind of people BIG time right now and its awesome.  There ARE actually people out there who believe what I do, but still know how live a life of excitement and fun and that makes me really excited.  Anyways after the girls lost to the guys in this crazy game, we left Denham and met up with Ken's friend Katie, along with Zane, Daniel and two guys I didn't know, to see Constantine.  I don't know that I know what to say about that movie...while it was a lil disappointing, sitting between Daniel and Ken was an interesting experience.  Their opinions on "typical females" cracks me up...hopefully I'll get the chance to let them see that all of us aren't  THAT bad.  Welp, I've been rambling on for too long and I've got to get to the bball game or Drew is gonna shoot me...HE WON LAST NIGHT (and i missed it :( ...but congrats to the track team, they kicked butt yet again).  I'm out...
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/1085.html

I don't want perfect. I don't want impressive. I want authentic. Genuine, honest and real regardless of what society expects or desires. I want to be loved. I don't want to need or be needed. Desire should be a strong "want"...devotion; an interest that does not grow possessive, annoyed, irritated or overpowering. It should feel like an unstated known. No worries, no stress, no apprehension. It should be easy, but not dull. I want excitement; I want captivation, intrigue and mystery. I don't want baggage and I don't want to bring baggage. I want accountability, growth, wisdom...someone who will equally challenge, push, support, and comfort me as I do them. I want someone I can respect. I want someone who can respect and value me. It feels like there is no one left worth pursuing anymore. It feels like no one truly knows what they want at this age. So many things attract us, spark interest, but very few things are worth holding on to. I am frustrated and confused, but I know that anything worth having is worth being patient for. I am choosing to be patient for what I want, and more importantly for what I KNOW God has planned for me. Despite what society is screaming in my face day to day, I refuse to settle for mediocrity...for mere comfort to satisfy temporary "needs". God has placed strong desires on my heart and that is what I am waiting for...that is what I want.

Today is Robyn's talent show and I am feeling overwhelmed by the support I've seen from people at LSU.  To imagine that in two weeks the entire athletic department put together such an amazing event just for her makes me extremly happy that I am where I am.  Despite all of the differences between this huge community of people...I can honestly say that they have truly become a part of my family. I've taken for granted the girls that surround me with support from day to day, and it upsets me that it has taken so much hurt for me to see that.  I can't imagine what Rob is goin through...her strength and courage are in inspiration.  Having had such a tough year myself, to watch her walk through this seemingly impossible obstacle she unknowingly challanges me to continue to persevere.  Tonight I am yet again stepping out of my "box" of comfort and trying and doing things I never imagined myself capable of.   While only a few months ago the thought of being on stage making a butt out of myself would have scared me to death, today I am actually ok with it...maybe even excited about it.  Yes, a big part of it has to do with the fact that tonight is for Robyn, but I like to think that another part of it has to do with me starting to grow.  The fear of being myself, the fear of stepping out and being bold has been and probably always will be there, but it just doesn't matter anymore.  I am no longer allowing people and situations to define me...instead I am chosing to listen to what my Creator says that I am and what I can be...and for once, I am actually HAPPY.  Yes, I've always been happy, but never with the knowlege that my joy could not be taken away...that it rested in the hands of a higher source and that He alone can make me happy regardless of my current situations.  Thank you Robyn for teaching me so much.  You are continually on my heart and in my prayers...tonight is for you!!!
http://steffa624.livejournal.com/960.html

So everybody seems to have one of these, how do you say..."bloggger" things now.  It's kinda fun to read what all people put in these journal thingys.  I'm slowly starting to learn that the rest of the world doesn't always think the way I do.  WOW, who wouldda thunk it?  The more I am starting to try to understand that, the more I realize just how much I don't "get" people...maybe this can help yall understand me a lil better, and hopefully it will allow you guys to help me learn some stuff too.  I figure since writing down what's on my mind has always helped to sort out my life of craziness, MAYBE--just maybe, some of you might find it interesting or at least give you something to laugh at for a while.  Im a lil bit apprehensive about puttin everything out there for the whole world to see (I tend to be a lil more honest with myself when it's down on paper)...but I hope you can just take it for what its worth and at least tell me to get a grip if need be...
